description.compact: Get's the file info from the file.
Enable fix mode. It's used to prevent report twice details because fixer relaunch process method.
The absolute path to the file associated with this object.
The content of the file.
The config data for the run.
The ruleset used for the run.
If TRUE, the entire file is being ignored.
The EOL character this file uses.
The Fixer object to control fixing errors.
The tokenizer being used for this file.
The name of the tokenizer being used for this file.
Was the file loaded from cache?

docblock.description: If TRUE, the file was loaded from a local cache. If FALSE, the file was tokenized and processed fully.

description.compact: The number of tokens in this file.

docblock.description: Stored here to save calling count() everywhere.

description.compact: The tokens stack map.
The errors raised from sniffs.
The warnings raised from sniffs.
The metrics recorded by sniffs.
The total number of errors raised.
The total number of warnings raised.
The total number of errors and warnings that can be fixed.
The total number of errors and warnings that were fixed.
TRUE if errors are being replayed from the cache.
An array of sniffs that are being ignored.
An array of message codes that are being ignored.
An array of sniffs listening to this file's processing.
The class name of the sniff currently processing the file.
An array of sniffs being processed and how long they took.
A cache of often used config settings to improve performance.

docblock.description: Storing them here saves 10k+ calls to __get() in the Config class.

description.compact: Constructs a file.

param.description: The absolute path to the file to process.
The ruleset used for the run.
The config data for the run.

description.compact: Set the content of the file.

docblock.description: Setting the content also calculates the EOL char being used.

param.description: The file content.

description.compact: Reloads the content of the file.

docblock.description: By default, we have no idea where our content comes from, so we can't do anything.

description.compact: Disables caching of this file.
Starts the stack traversal and tells listeners when tokens are found.

comment.value: Check if tokenizer errors cause this file to be ignored.
Foreach of the listeners that have registered to listen for this
token, get them to process it.
end foreach
If short open tags are off but the file being checked uses
short open tags, the whole content will be inline HTML
and nothing will be checked. So try and handle this case.
We don't show this error for STDIN because we can't be sure the content
actually came directly from the user. It could be something like
refs from a Git pre-push hook.

description.compact: Tokenizes the file and prepares it for the test run.

comment.value: Check for mixed line endings as these can cause tokenizer errors and we
should let the user know that the results they get may be incorrect.
This is done by removing all backslashes, removing the newline char we
detected, then converting newlines chars into text. If any backslashes
are left at the end, we have additional newline chars in use.

description.compact: Returns the token stack for this file.
Remove vars stored in this file that are no longer required.
Records an error against a specific token in the file.

param.description: The error message.
The stack position where the error occurred.
A violation code unique to the sniff message.

The severity level for this error. A value of 0

docblock.param: will be converted into the default severity level.

param.description: Can the error be fixed by the sniff?

docblock.param: will be converted into the default severity level.

docblock.param: will be converted into the default severity level.

param.description: The error message.

description.compact: Adds an error to the error stack.

param.description: Is this an error message?
The text of the message.
The line on which the message occurred.
The column at which the message occurred.
A violation code unique to the sniff message.
Replacements for the message.
The severity level for this message. A value of 0

docblock.param: will be converted into the default severity level.

param.description: Can the problem be fixed by the sniff?

comment.value: Check if this line is ignoring all message codes.
Work out which sniff generated the message.
end if
end if
Filter out any messages for sniffs that shouldn't have run
due to the use of the --sniffs command line argument.
If we know this sniff code is being ignored for this file, return early.
Make sure we are not ignoring this file.
end if
See if there is a custom error message format to use.
But don't do this if we are replaying errors because replayed
errors have already used the custom format and have had their
data replaced.

description.compact: Record a metric about the file being examined.

param.description: The stack position where the metric was recorded.
The name of the metric being recorded.
The value of the metric being recorded.

description.compact: Returns the number of errors raised.
Returns the number of warnings raised.
Returns the number of fixable errors/warnings raised.
Returns the number of fixed errors/warnings.
Returns the list of ignored lines.
Returns the errors raised from processing this file.
Returns the warnings raised from processing this file.
Returns the metrics found while processing this file.
Returns the absolute filename of this file.
Returns the declaration names for classes, interfaces, traits, and functions.

param.description: The position of the declaration token which

docblock.param: declared the class, interface, trait, or function.

return.description: The name of the class, interface, trait, or function;

docblock.return: or NULL if the function or class is anonymous.

throws.description: If the specified token is not of type

docblock.throws: T_FUNCTION, T_CLASS, T_ANON_CLASS, T_CLOSURE, T_TRAIT, or T_INTERFACE.

description.compact: Returns the method parameters for the specified function token.

docblock.description: Also supports passing in a USE token for a closure use group. Each parameter is in the following format: 0 => array( 'name' => '$var', // The variable name. 'token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the variable name. 'content' => string, // The full content of the variable definition. 'has_attributes' => boolean, // Does the parameter have one or more attributes attached ? 'pass_by_reference' => boolean, // Is the variable passed by reference? 'reference_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the reference operator // or FALSE if the param is not passed by reference. 'variable_length' => boolean, // Is the param of variable length through use of `...` ? 'variadic_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the ... operator // or FALSE if the param is not variable length. 'type_hint' => string, // The type hint for the variable. 'type_hint_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the start of the type hint // or FALSE if there is no type hint. 'type_hint_end_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the end of the type hint // or FALSE if there is no type hint. 'nullable_type' => boolean, // TRUE if the type is preceded by the nullability // operator. 'comma_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the comma after the param // or FALSE if this is the last param. ) Parameters with default values have additional array indexes of: 'default' => string, // The full content of the default value. 'default_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the start of the default value. 'default_equal_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the equals sign. Parameters declared using PHP 8 constructor property promotion, have these additional array indexes: 'property_visibility' => string, // The property visibility as declared. 'visibility_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the visibility modifier token.

param.description: The position in the stack of the function token

docblock.param: to acquire the parameters for.

throws.description: If the specified $stackPtr is not of

docblock.throws: type T_FUNCTION, T_CLOSURE, T_USE, or T_FN.

comment.value: end for

description.compact: Returns the visibility and implementation properties of a method.

docblock.description: The format of the return value is: array( 'scope' => 'public', // Public, private, or protected 'scope_specified' => true, // TRUE if the scope keyword was found. 'return_type' => '', // The return type of the method. 'return_type_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the start of the return type // or FALSE if there is no return type. 'return_type_end_token' => integer, // The stack pointer to the end of the return type // or FALSE if there is no return type. 'nullable_return_type' => false, // TRUE if the return type is preceded by the // nullability operator. 'is_abstract' => false, // TRUE if the abstract keyword was found. 'is_final' => false, // TRUE if the final keyword was found. 'is_static' => false, // TRUE if the static keyword was found. 'has_body' => false, // TRUE if the method has a body );

param.description: The position in the stack of the function token to

docblock.param: acquire the properties for.

throws.description: If the specified position is not a

comment.value: end for
end if

description.compact: Returns the visibility and implementation properties of a class member var.

param.description: The position in the stack of the T_VARIABLE token to

docblock.param: acquire the properties for.

throws.description: If the specified position is not a

docblock.throws: T_VARIABLE token, or if the position is not a class member variable.

comment.value: Make sure it's not a method parameter.
end for
end if

description.compact: Returns the visibility and implementation properties of a class.

docblock.description: The format of the return value is: array( 'is_abstract' => false, // true if the abstract keyword was found. 'is_final' => false, // true if the final keyword was found. );

param.description: The position in the stack of the T_CLASS token to

docblock.param: acquire the properties for.

throws.description: If the specified position is not a

comment.value: end for

description.compact: Determine if the passed token is a reference operator.

docblock.description: Returns true if the specified token position represents a reference. Returns false if the token represents a bitwise operator.

param.description: The position of the T_BITWISE_AND token.

comment.value: end if
Pass by reference in function calls and assign by reference in arrays.
end if

description.compact: Returns the content of the tokens from the specified start position in the token stack for the specified length.

param.description: The position to start from in the token stack.
The length of tokens to traverse from the start pos.
Whether the original content or the tab replaced

docblock.param: content should be used.

throws.description: If the specified position does not exist.

description.compact: Returns the position of the previous specified token(s).

docblock.description:
If a value is specified, the previous token of the specified type(s) containing the specified value will be returned.
Returns false if no token can be found.

param.description: The type(s) of tokens to search for.
The position to start searching from in the

docblock.param: token stack.

param.description: The end position to fail if no token is found.

docblock.param: if not specified or null, end will default to the start of the token stack.

param.description: If true, find the previous token that is NOT of

docblock.param: the types specified in $types.

param.description: The value that the token(s) must be equal to.

docblock.param: If value is omitted, tokens with any value will be returned.

param.description: If true, tokens outside the current statement

docblock.param: will not be checked. IE. checking will stop at the previous semi-colon found.

comment.value: end for

description.compact: Returns the position of the next specified token(s).

docblock.description:
If a value is specified, the next token of the specified type(s) containing the specified value will be returned.
Returns false if no token can be found.

param.description: The type(s) of tokens to search for.
The position to start searching from in the

docblock.param: token stack.

param.description: The end position to fail if no token is found.

docblock.param: if not specified or null, end will default to the end of the token stack.

param.description: If true, find the next token that is NOT of

docblock.param: a type specified in $types.

param.description: The value that the token(s) must be equal to.

docblock.param: If value is omitted, tokens with any value will be returned.

param.description: If true, tokens outside the current statement

docblock.param: will not be checked. i.e., checking will stop at the next semi-colon found.

comment.value: end for

description.compact: Returns the position of the first non-whitespace token in a statement.

param.description: The position to start searching from in the token stack.
Token types that should not be considered stop points.

comment.value: If the start token is inside the case part of a match expression,
find the start of the condition. If it's in the statement part, find
the token that comes after the match arrow.
end if
If we are starting at a token that ends a scope block, skip to
the start and continue from there.
If we are starting at a token that ends a statement, skip this
token so we find the true start of the statement.
end for

description.compact: Returns the position of the last non-whitespace token in a statement.

param.description: The position to start searching from in the token stack.
Token types that should not be considered stop points.

comment.value: If the start token is inside the case part of a match expression,
advance to the match arrow and continue looking for the
end of the statement from there so that we skip over commas.
end if
end for

description.compact: Returns the position of the first token on a line, matching given type.

docblock.description: Returns false if no token can be found.

param.description: The type(s) of tokens to search for.
The position to start searching from in the

docblock.param: token stack. The first token matching on this line before this token will be returned.

param.description: If true, find the token that is NOT of

docblock.param: the types specified in $types.

param.description: The value that the token must be equal to.

docblock.param: If value is omitted, tokens with any value will be returned.

comment.value: end for

description.compact: Determine if the passed token has a condition of one of the passed types.

param.description: The position of the token we are checking.
The type(s) of tokens to search for.

comment.value: Check for the existence of the token.
Make sure the token has conditions.

description.compact: Return the position of the condition for the passed token.

docblock.description: Returns FALSE if the token does not have the condition.

param.description: The position of the token we are checking.
The type of token to search for.
If TRUE, will return the matched condition

docblock.param: furthest away from the passed token. If FALSE, will return the matched condition closest to the passed token.

comment.value: Check for the existence of the token.
Make sure the token has conditions.

description.compact: Returns the name of the class that the specified class extends.

docblock.description:
(works for classes, anonymous classes and interfaces)
Returns FALSE on error or if there is no extended class name.

param.description: The stack position of the class.

comment.value: Check for the existence of the token.

description.compact: Returns the names of the interfaces that the specified class implements.

docblock.description: Returns FALSE on error or if there are no implemented interface names.

param.description: The stack position of the class.

comment.value: Check for the existence of the token.
